III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12605 – Adoptive family evaluation
Section
Description • (3) The report must assess all the following:
• (c) Previous criminal convictions and confirmed child
abuse or neglect or concerns brought to the agency
or department's attention for any member of the
household.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Agency completed an inadequate adoption family assessment as
they did not adequately assess alleged sexual behaviors of the
adoptive applicant father as a part of the adoptive family
assessment.
Investigation Interviews:
I interviewed Complainant by phone on 02/07/2025.
Complainant stated a referral had been made to Child Protective
Services (CPS) involving pornography associated with the
adoptive applicant father and CPS was not investigating the
allegation. Complainant stated there was also a referral to law
enforcement, but Complainant was unaware of the status of the
referral to law enforcement. Complainant described the nature of
the allegation was the adoptive applicant father had secretly
videotaped the adoptive applicant father's sister-in-law changing
clothes. Complainant stated Complainant was not aware if the
sister-in-law was an adult or minor at the time of the alleged
videotaping. Complainant stated Complainant did not think the
agency assessed alleged inappropriate behaviors by the adoption
applicant father as a part of the adoptive family assessment. At
the time of the complaint the adoption had been finalized.
I interviewed Chief Administrator by phone on 02/07/2025.
Chief Administrator referred me to Program Director and provided
contact information for Program Director.
I interviewed Program Director by phone on 02/13/2025.
Program Director was knowledgeable about the
situation/allegations. Program Director stated the issue was
addressed in the adoptive family assessment as well as an
addendum that was completed following the reported allegations.
Program Director stated CPS was contacted but was not
investigating the allegations as reported. Program Director stated
law enforcement was contacted but was unaware of the status of
that referral. Program Director stated the addendum to the
adoptive family assessment was completed between the time of
the adoptive placement of the child and adoption finalization.
Adoptive placement was 08/16/2024 and adoption finalization was
02/05/2025.
I interviewed Adoption Worker by phone on 03/26/2025.
Adoption Worker had no concerns regarding the qualifications and
appropriateness of the adoptive parents. Adoption Worker
2

confirmed CPS did not investigate the allegations and at this time
Adoption Worker did not think law enforcement had pursued an
investigation as Adoption Worker was not provided a case number
or any additional related information by law enforcement to include
in the addendum study completed by Adoption Worker.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed the Adoption Family Home Study dated 06/12/2024.
The initial evaluation included an assessment of the adoptive
father applicant's behavior, characteristics, and appropriateness
for adoption. State criminal record clearances, FBI, DMV/SOS,
and Central Registry Clearances were all completed with no
concerns identified. The determination of this assessment was
approval for adoption.
I reviewed the addendum to the Adoption Family Assessment
dated 01/21/2025. The addendum was completed following the
reported allegations by someone identified as a family friend. The
addendum included additional details related to the behaviors of
the applicant adoptive father's behaviors reported in the initial
family evaluation. The edited initial home study stated the
following:
Applicant Father admits to using unwanted sexual behaviors as a
coping mechanism. He shared he used pornography and
objectified women. He had access to computer pornography his
entire life and frequented the Tinder app to “hook up” with women.
Applicant Father shared this with Applicant Mother, and they
reached out to Pastor B for help. Pastor B had Applicant Father
join a bible study and a group whose premise is to work with those
struggling with pornography. Collaborating with Pastor B and the
other men who share in this struggle has empowered Applicant
Father and he is part of a new ministry at church that creates safe
space for those looking for support. He is very passionate about
helping others. Applicant Father continues to check in with his
accountability partner, and there is no web browser on his phone
– he keeps it locked out.
The edited addendum dated 01/21/2025 included the following:
Applicant Father admitted himself to an in-patient treatment facility
in November of 2024 for help with his pornography addiction.
Applicant Father attended the Begin Again Institute for 14 days, a
treatment center specifically geared for those suffering with a
sexual addiction. Applicant Father has taken his sexual addiction
3

recovery very seriously. Applicant Father disclosed his sexual
addiction to this worker during the home study, individual interview
in March of 2024. He was open and forthcoming about his past
discretions with pornography. Applicant Father explained he once
used pornography as a coping mechanism but had learned new
coping skills thanks to therapy, both individual and group.
Applicant Father stated he had not used pornography since he
and Applicant Mother married in October of 2019. Applicant
Father relapsed in the early fall of 2024 and sought in-patient
treatment in November of 2024. Applicant Father is currently
receiving therapy and support from multiple sources. Applicant
Mother is also seeking therapy and support from experts as well
as mentors familiar with being the spouse of someone suffering
with a Sexual Addiction.
Character reference letters of support from 10 different people
including professional therapists.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per interviews and
documents reviewed the agency completed an addendum to
assess adoptive applicant father after the allegations came to light
prior to adoption occurring.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
